content.description: This is a fun problem on good pockets.
content.location: Approximately 5 ft right of a shallow dihedral SDS with hands matched in a small hueco, then climb up and right on pockets to a sloping topout on crimps.

content.description: The alternate name might be "out of the bushes" due to the thick shrubs growing around it. Despite that this is an interesting feature providing a semi-compression style problem.
content.location: Located in the corridor on the south side facing Abusement Park. SDS in the bushes and climb the bulging prow using crimps, pockets, or compression.

content.description: This is a unique style of problem for the area involving a lieback of a thin fin of rock. This feature does appear to be potentially unstable so proceed with caution
content.location: SDS and lieback until the fin terminates, then finish the topout on small pockets.

content.description: This is not a boulder per se but a section of the cliff line on the east rim of the canyon that has some interesting features to climb at easily accessible grades.
